Develop

Merge pull request #13 from KirillKryukov/develop

Develop

Merge pull request #11 from KirillKryukov/develop

Version 1.3.0
Add test for empty sequence name

Merge pull request #9 from KirillKryukov/develop

Add support for multi-file archives

Merge pull request #8 from KirillKryukov/develop

Version 1.2.0

Merge pull request #6 from KirillKryukov/develop

Update citation and benchmark

Merge pull request #5 from KirillKryukov/develop

v.1.1.0. Minor fixes and improvements.
Fix streaming mode in MinGW builds
Auto-name output files only when restoring original format

Merge pull request #3 from KirillKryukov/develop

Version 1.1.0-beta. Test suite and minor fixes.
Fix typos and add missing details
Implement --no-mask for text and protein sequences for --seq and --fasta output of unnaf
Add tests for protein and text modes
Enable --no-mask option for protein and text sequences

Encapsulate and rework the temporary files logic

Now temporary files are no longer used when the data is small. Also code is now better structured and less repetitive.
Add link to Text-vs-DNA mode benchmark
Clarify treatment of '>' characters in FASTA-formatted text sequences
Fix compressing multiple sequences in text mode

Merge pull request #2 from KirillKryukov/develop

Develop
Add intructions for building from latest unreleased source
Explain how to preserve non-standard sequence characters
Improve parser robustness and add --well-formed switch
Add -c and -o options to decompressor manual

Use constant memory during compression

Before the compressor was loading each entire sequence into memory. Now it compresses piece by piece. It's also a bit faster.
Add protein support in FASTQ format
Don't close and reopen temp files
Report name of read with unexpected quality character
Refactor reporting number of unexpected characters
Report name of sequence where unexpected character was found
Add support for rare amino-acid codes
Implement strict parsing of FASTQ format
Correct detection of last line length
Add draft of NAF specification version 2
Remove incomplete output file on failure
Use 256 as end of input marker
Implement strict parsing of FASTA format
Increase strictness of input format detection
Add compatibility with Mac OS X
Tighten parsing of variable length encoded number

Preserve timestamp, permissions and ownership

Initial implementation of transferring input file status to the output file. Tested on various linuxes and on windows using cygwin and MinGW.
Add automatic naming of output file
More accurate reading of input file extension
Refactor and unify command line parsing

Simplify file copying

Keep track of data stored in the temp files internally. Makes code simpler to follow and file copying more robust.

Change from using read and poll to fread

Improves compatibility with systems that don't provide poll, such as MinGW

Remove -flto

Enables compatibility with old GCC versions
Handle case of FASTQ output and no qualities in input
Add --no-mask option, enable masking by default
Don't write binary data to terminal
Fix possible integer overflow on malformed input
Add version, stop reading binary data from terminal
Don't write binary data to terminal
Fix decompressing with line length of 0
Use double dash for command line options
Update source headers, silence some warnings
Improve input parser, make C version default
Add initial C port of ennaf
Add zstd link, explain compression strength option
Expand installation manual, clarify temp dir setting
Improve error message about unspecified temporary directory
Force install target to overwrite existing symlink
Add top level Makefile, add uninstall target
